title: Human Hydrogen Bomb
body:
fandom: Stony (Steve x Tony), implied Winterfalcon (Sam x Bucky), preferably read in MCU Age of Ultron timeline

warning: Steve being a disgusting sunshine (flatulence).

summary: The mornings in the Avengers Tower are rarely calm, but this time Steve crossed a line.

length: 1 018 words

a/n: my yet another attempt at being funny ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ . I swear I am usually more mature than this. gonna tag @kigichi here, because a certain chat with her added more depth to my innocent idea of Steve being a stink bomb.

—————

Human Hydrogen Bomb

It was a slow morning in the Avengers Tower, which was probably the best kind of mornings. Clint was seated in the kitchen, silently munching on a bowl of cereal, or as silently as crushing milk soaked Lucky Charms between your teeth could be, still in an old pair of sweatpants and a dirty shirt he used for sleeping. He wasn’t alone in the kitchen, and Natasha was standing at the counter, pouring herself another cup of strong coffee, clad in a tank top with spaghetti straps and loose cotton sweatpants, not paying attention to Clint or Wanda who was making a pot of oatmeal for everyone, and being the only person in the small gathering who actually had a proper set of pajamas in a form of a long-sleeved nightshirt, pink and ending down to her knees. Soon more team members would come for breakfast and—

PRRRRRVVVTT!

At the low, threatening sound, Clint raised his head up and Wanda dropped the wooden spoon into the pot. Only Natasha remained unaffected.

“Oh no, not again,” Clint grumbled to himself focusing back on cereals. Wanda opened her mouth to ask if that was what she thought it was when noises from the living room interrupted everything.

“STEVE!!”

There was a yelp, a laugh, and soon, Tony, bare feet and in black tank top and sweatpants, a set that doubled as pajamas and working clothes for him, barreled into the kitchen, red-faced and hollering.

Clint observed with a stoic face as his friend doubled over with laughter and practically lied down on the table, not able to stand straight from laughing so hard. At the scene, Natasha remained still unaffected, and only Wanda looked from one team member to the other, searching for answers.

Soon Steve joined the part of the team in the kitchen, matching everyone in terms of pajamas, and presenting his own set of plaid flannel pajamas, smiling proudly.

“You guys don’t want to go there for a while,” he said instead of the traditional good morning and closed the door to the kitchen, waving his hand in the air.

At the comment, Tony hollered some more, and Clint silently chewed his cereals, eyes not leaving Tony as he started to wonder when the brunet would pass out from the lack of oxygen.

“You are burning oatmeal,” Natasha said to Wanda, and the girl jumped a bit, quickly taking off the pot from the low flame.

“Please don’t burn anything,” Clint sighed, taking another spoonful of cereals, “officially this is the only place with fresh air in this part of the Tower since Steve dropped the human hydrogen bomb.”

“The what…?” Wanda asked, scraping the good part of oatmeal to a separate pot.

“Ah, that felt good!” Steve stretched with a relaxed smile, “I was holding it in for the whole night!”

“You need better ventilation system in your bedroom,” Natasha pointed out calmly.

“It is not about ventilation, Tony doesn’t allow me to pass gas in our room,” Steve explained and looked at his laughing husband with fondness. Wanda just stood there. Were they really discussing this?

“How considerate of you,” Natasha cooed falsely. “You just stunk up the room we all hang out in.”

“Is the ‘no farting’ rule a thing since that time you did in the bedroom and stuffed Tony under the covers?” Clint asked, trying to not laugh on his own, still remembering the indignant screams Tony had been eliciting back then which echoed in the whole Tower.

“Pretty much,” Steve beamed, leaning past Wanda to get an apple from the fruit bowl and winking at the stunned girl.

“You are lucky he finds it amusing,” Natasha said, meaning Tony who was still laughing and becoming red in the face.

“Consider yourself lucky you weren’t here when Steve and Thor met,” Clint said and Wanda turned to look at him, hearing the words directed to her, “they had a contest.”

“It was like they made their own language,” Natasha gave her comment,  remembering that one fateful evening after which they had to replace the couch Steve and Thor had been sitting on. At the memory, Tony laughed even harder, which was quite a feat.

“Hey, Tony,” Steve hooked a finger at the band of Tony’s sweatpants and tugged him over. “You’re gonna pop a vein if you keep laughing that long,” he said, grinning at his husband’s red face and sparkling eyes.

“I love you so muhhahahach,” Tony giggled, wrapping arms around Steve’s neck and standing on his tiptoes, laughing into soldier’s chest.

“Hey, what’s the— WHAT THE— DID SOMEONE DIE HERE OR WHAT—”

“Bucky woke up,” Steve said with a crass smile, hearing his friend screaming from the living room.

“THE HELL—”

“Hey, Buck, what’s the— WOAH!! Was that you?!”

“What?! NO, Sam, I swear—”

“Maaaan! You are one nasty guy! Bucknasty! Bucknasteeeey!”

“Sam, that— SAM!” everyone heard the door slamming as Sam had left the room, leaving Bucky alone. “Steve, I will murder you!!”

Wanda blinked, watching everyone going back to their morning routines and hearing Bucky scrambling in the living room, yelling about someone opening the window and wrestling with the locked door, needing to escape.

“Um… Shouldn’t someone help him?” Wanda asked shyly, hearing as cursing intensified.

“Naaah, just give him a moment more to enjoy it,” Steve grinned, waving his hand dismissively and Tony burst on a whole new level of squeaky giggling.

“I love you evehehehehen more,” Tony confessed with a bright smile and quickly pecked Steve’s lips a few times in succession.

Wanda looked over the small group. Natasha and Clint focused back on their meals, Steve and Tony cuddling in the corner, all accompanied by Bucky’s screamed out threats.

That was her new life. That was her family.

“Oatmeal?” she asked the group, deciding to roll with it and Steve called for a portion, while Tony started his usual morning search for donuts.

And when Bucky was let out and into the kitchen, true to his words, he did try to murder Steve. But it was just another thing for Tony to laugh about.

blog.name: askyourfavouriteotp
blog.title: Ask your OTP
blog.description:
This an ask blog where you can ask

WinterFalcon / Merthur / Spideypool /
ScarletVision / Matt x Foggy x Karen

whatever you wanna know!

Gifs are a mix of things found on the web and our own gifs, feel free to use them!

Please be respectful both to the ship and person answering while sending in your question

SCHEDULE

summary: Tony and Steve coming back home
title: Tony and Steve coming back home
body:
“Hey, we are back!”

“Don’t yell, stupid! Muffins are sleeping at his hour. Or they should be, if other two stupids listened to my schedule. If they messed up twins sleep pattern, I will hurt them.” 

*Sam whispers* “Shush Chris is sleeping.”

“Becky wanted a snack sue me.” *Bucky is feeding Robbie a bottle of milk*

“So how was your trip?”

“Ahhh, my Little Princess. You got so big during the week we were apart. I just hope you are washing your hands after touching demon dog and then my girl.”

“It was… fine. Once I got Tony out of the baby mode. I couldn’t stop him from purreing apples for me, though.”

*Bucky smirks* “I do don’t think it does much help when Anastasia gives her licks like she’s her own pup though.”

*Sam snorts* “Are you kidding you had to eat applesauce? Poor Steve but you both had a good time right while I looked after three kids.”

“Hey, I’m not a kid just cause I ate those animal crackers and applesauce. It was one time.” *He burps Robbie.* “Tony do you want to hold Robbie. I think she missed her daddy.”

“Did you seriously just ask me if I want to hold my daughter?”

“I am surprised you didn’t wrench her out from Bucky’s arms. And applesauce is good.”

“Yes, yes I want her.”

*Bucky shrugs and looks down at Robbie and hesitates before handing her to Tony* “Ducky is her favorite toy…she sleeps better with it.”

*Sam places a hand on Bucky* “Well we’re glad you both had a good trip. You can bring the twins over whenever you want. They were good kids.”

“Heey Princess. Did you have fun?” *Tony cooes while holding Robbie* “Daddy missed you so so so so much.”

„You can visit them too, you know. And if we will need a babysitter, I will give you a call.”

„Uh oh. Better not be so hasty about this, honey. I got like 10 000 messages from Wade listing all the reasons why he and Peter should babysit our kids.”

„You too, huh?”

*Chris wakes up and blabs excitedly seeing his parents back*

“Ah, my other sunshine.” *he pick Chris up and hold them both* “Hi, my handsome son. My two little bowling balls.”

“Really? That would be great. I’m going to miss them.”

*Sam pats Bucky on the back* “Well we should be leaving. We haven’t been home in two weeks so who knows what has happened since we left.”

“But the pets weren’t there?”

“Right but we left in a rush and haven’t unpacked everything from the long trip so lots of cleaning remember.”

“Oh yeah. Well, guess we’ll see you later.”

*Tony and Steve exchange quick looks*

„Hey Buck, seeing that you are already here, can you give me a hand? Chris will start to cry if he won’t get a bottle soon, and I am pretty sure Robbie is so chipper because her diaper is full.” 

*Robbie looks all smug*

“You are just a little stinker like your papa, aren’t you?”

“Good girl, Becky. And later we can all go on a walk, babies and Anastasia. And Sam can purree lunch for us.”

“I can help with the diaper. Became an expert over the last week.”

“You really want purree or do you want real food Steve.” *Sam teases getting ready to cook in the kitchen.*

“Whichever is faster. I will unpack the car.”

*twins are happy that everyone is present*

that concludes Sam and Bucky babysitting! 

Stony and their kids will return for some more events!

title: 021/100 | Vertigo | Tony/Loki | G
body:
The premise of the 100 AUs is incredibly simple.  I love this gif, and I hate Civil War, so I’m just going to keep rewriting the scene as long as I can.  The goal is 100 but lets see how far I make it.

It just hadn’t felt right.  It had always felt like this:

A quiet shift to the left, the sudden and inexplicable sensation of having been moved without ever having moved at all.  The slow-motion hyper awareness of a chair being pulled out from under you.  

It felt like inertia pulling in the opposite direction as they were moving.  Like being on an escalator travelling upward but still going down.  

Like vertigo.

It just hadn’t ever felt right.  Not since the morning Steve had woken up in a world where Tony Stark was dating Loki the Trickster God (not that they called Loki that to his face).  Men who spent too long trying to think about that got into the habit of shaking their heads, like they could get the idea out if they knocked it around enough.

Thor didn’t come to earth very often anymore, every time he did, he spent the whole time smacking the side of his head like he could drain the wrongness out of his ear.  It was like a bit of water stuck in your ear canal.  You could feel it but you couldn’t get it out.

Tony didn’t seem to notice, he didn’t appear to find it weird.  

(Why was it weird?  Why was it weird at all when all Steve could remember was the world exactly like this.  Tony had started dating Loki almost a year ago.  They’d met casually, when Loki was visiting.  They’d fallen in love.

Why was it weird?

Why did Steve keep looking at Pepper like he expected more out of her than exasperation at Tony being kept out late by his mischievous boyfriend.  Why was he waiting for Rhodey to react with alarm?  Why couldn’t he shake the sensation that Clint should be more likely to stab the man than play cards with him?

Why?

Why?

Why?)

Steve had developed an idea, a quiet and private idea, that he kept to himself.  He had the notion that they were living in a bubble.  He couldn’t find the edge of the bubble but he was certain it was there.  He was certain once he did find it, once he pushed his finger into it, the wrongness would pop.  

Rightness would be restored.

Until then, he was left with this sensation, this idea that thing were not as they should be.  That Tony did not belong with Loki, that Loki was not a harmless prankster at all.

(That, given the choice, Steve would just as happily punched the man as shaken his hand.)

“It’s come to my attention,” was Loki’s greeting to the latest Avengers’ meeting, “that my welcome is not as warm as I had been lead to believe.  I’ve recently heard there are those among you who think I have dishonorable intentions.”

Among them was a funny thing to say when they’d planned a meeting Thor couldn’t be there for.  A meeting that Bruce hadn’t been invited to.  It was only Steve, and Natasha, and Clint and Rhodey and Sam and Steve.

It was Steve that Loki stared at.  It was Steve that could see the glimmer of that bubble surrounding them.  Sooner or later he was going to get his fingers on the filmy edge of it.  Until then, he looked over his shoulder, back at Tony rubbing his forehead like he was getting a migraine.

(Did Tony always have migraines?  Did Tony always look so worn, so ragged, so defeated?  As if he’d been robbed of color and good humor and rest?  Did he always?)

“I don’t know what you heard,” Steve said with a liar’s tongue sounding off in his righteous mouth, “but I think I speak for everyone when I say we’re glad to have you on our side.”

For now.  Until Steve could prove something (prove anything).  

Loki’s smile was clever and cruel, it was perfectly pleased as it stared Steve down.  They were aware of each other now, aware that there was something to be aware of.  

“See?” Tony said, “I told you.”

[Other AUs here]

Steve had developed an idea, a quiet and private idea, that he kept to himself.  He had the notion that they were living in a bubble.  He couldn’t find the edge of the bubble but he was certain it was there.  He was certain once he did find it, once he pushed his finger into it, the wrongness would pop.  

Rightness would be restored.

Until then, he was left with this sensation, this idea that thing were not as they should be.  That Tony did not belong with Loki, that Loki was not a harmless prankster at all.

(That, given the choice, Steve would just as happily punched the man as shaken his hand.)

“It’s come to my attention,” was Loki’s greeting to the latest Avengers’ meeting, “that my welcome is not as warm as I had been lead to believe.  I’ve recently heard there are those among you who think I have dishonorable intentions.”

Among them was a funny thing to say when they’d planned a meeting Thor couldn’t be there for.  A meeting that Bruce hadn’t been invited to.  It was only Steve, and Natasha, and Clint and Rhodey and Sam and Steve.

It was Steve that Loki stared at.  It was Steve that could see the glimmer of that bubble surrounding them.  Sooner or later he was going to get his fingers on the filmy edge of it.  Until then, he looked over his shoulder, back at Tony rubbing his forehead like he was getting a migraine.

(Did Tony always have migraines?  Did Tony always look so worn, so ragged, so defeated?  As if he’d been robbed of color and good humor and rest?  Did he always?)

“I don’t know what you heard,” Steve said with a liar’s tongue sounding off in his righteous mouth, “but I think I speak for everyone when I say we’re glad to have you on our side.”

For now.  Until Steve could prove something (prove anything).  

Loki’s smile was clever and cruel, it was perfectly pleased as it stared Steve down.  They were aware of each other now, aware that there was something to be aware of.  

“See?” Tony said, “I told you.”

answer: Ah. *hugs back* Thank you, dear. I’m having two children one with Loki’s DNA and one with Tony’s. body:
Dating Tony Stark Would Include:

- Him being snarky and in denial when it comes to his feelings for you.

- “What? Y/N? Yeah right, C'mon I’m a genius I don’t have time for nonsense and feelings.”

- Tony being over protective ASF. I mean come on the guy has lost a lot in his life time.

-Tony brushing off the rest of The Avengers’ teasing about him being over protective or when it comes to you in general.

“I’m only going to ask this once. Fuck off, all of you.”

-When he finally does accept his feelings towards you, he tries to keep it to himself. However the ones closest to him are painfully aware on how much he does like you.

- “J.A.R.V.I.S how do I ask Y/N out?”

-When Tony finally asks you out, he makes it sound like it isn’t a big deal, but little do you know he makes it a whole shi-bang. He really goes over the top to impress you.

- Candles, Live music, Fancy Dinner with a movie of your choice afterwards. A limo, a bouquet of flowers and a box of chocolates on your first date.

-Once you two have been dating for a while, you become more aware of each other’s quirks.

- “Tony stop Fucking falling asleep at the table and actually go to bed.”

- “You know this isn’t up for discussion right?”

- You finally convincing Tony to head up to bed after staying up all night or finding him passed out at a lab table, although it’s hard to convince him and it takes lots of bribing.

-Tony is usually really stoic and sarcastic, but completely melts when you hold his face in your hands or run fingers through his hair.

-Him multi-tasking as he spends time with you, such as doing pull-ups, reading articles on the recent news, or tinkering around with his gadgets.

- “You’re still listening right Tony?”

- “ Of course I am, continue I’m all ears.”

-Surprisingly soft, and gentle kisses between you two.

-LOTS of cuddling and massages for this man, Tony is always stressed or anxious about something, so be prepared to hold him close. But remember that he always returns the favor.

-He likes to tease you when he gets the chance, especially to get you hot and flustered, so lots of neck and ear nipping/ biting
